column5: Just caught this one in time, pays to walk around the trailer now and then
holy ---- THat is incredible.  Good thing you checked!  Cheers!
It's a good thing you pulled that Old Milwacky can outta   the tire when you did or it coulda done some REAL damage !!
Ha.....and my buddies say I'm too anal about my trailer.....I always check everything before I hit the road.....I haven't found anything to fix yet, but I'm sure I will one day.  Sinker
WOW may have been costly if it blew

smart thing to always check.. i never really looked at the tires that much.. i just check the air in them everytime, i guess i'll spot it while i check the air though. however i do check the lights every single time, before and returning fromt he trip.
Wow, Thats wild!!  Why does that happen?
Very good reminder for all of us.  I too check over the tires and make sure the tire pressures are corret before heading out.  That includes the boat trailer and the towing vehicle.
looks like one of the old looney tunes shows, where the bruise shoots out of the victims head after being clonked by a board :>
Broken belt Dan  I've had way to many Carlisle's look like that on my boat trailers to ever use another.  Whopper
Had a bulge like that in my side wall once- trailer tires are crap!
